channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12034] If I kill single RS in branch-1, all regions end up on Master!
item.description: This is unexpected. M should not be carrying regions in branch-1. Right Jimmy Xiang? Thanks.
item.summary: If I kill single RS in branch-1, all regions end up on Master!

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: If the regionserver is down, do you prefer regions to stay offline, instead of assigned to the master?

If the regionserver is down, do you prefer regions to stay offline, instead of assigned to the master?

That is how it used be, so in name of least surprise, yes, this is what I'd expect.
Yes, this is kind of unexpected. If we want regions to stay off master unless configured otherwise, let me think about how we can do that, without breaking pseudo distributed mode.
If we don't assign any region to the master, should we still show it on the web UI? It will always have 0 region on it.

Attached patch for branch 1 that rolled back some changes. Now, backup master doesn't host region, doesn't show in master web UI as a regionserver. Active master can host region only if configured so. Otherwise, it doesn't host any region, doesn't show in master web UI as a regionserver either. Ran unit tests, ITBLL, standalone mode, pseudo mode with no new config.
Also attached a patch for the master branch to have the similar behavior. The difference is that meta and namespace are put on active master by default, for the master branch.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12671585/hbase-12034_2.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12671585

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 24 new or modified tests.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 2 new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

These tests are ok on my box.
The first patch for branch 1 is on RB: https://reviews.apache.org/r/26116/

Integrated the patch into branch 1 and master. Thanks Stack for the review.

Tthe release note of HBASE-10569 is updated to reflect this change.

Reading the patch and HBASE-10923, the release notes are now outdated in the latter issue. There is now support for "none" as a value to host no regions on the master, as opposed to the original clunky " " (a space char) approach. Should the current code and approach be added to the release notes here?

Also, should the "hbase.balancer.tablesOnMaster" not be documented in hbase-default.xml? And secondly, should it not follow standard and write "tablesonmaster" all lower case, like "cacheonwrite" in another key?

Thanks a lot for pointed that out. I updated the release notes for HBASE-10923 a little about the "none" value. It is not reliable/feasible to use a space char. As to upper case, I saw similar usage in hbase-default.xml, for example, hbase.regionserver.regionSplitLimit, hbase.zookeeper.property.maxClientCnxns, etc. We have mixed usage. I am open to either way. One of the reason that it is not documented in hbase-default.xml is that this is not turned on by default in branch 1, and probably users should not touch it?
